author: Jatin Anand
text:
A District Magistrate deputed to probe the on-goings at the JNU campus has sent a video of the episode for forensic analysis to verify its authenticity.

A senior Delhi government official said the decision was taken by Sanjay Kumar, DM (New Delhi) district, after another video — claiming the first one was ‘doctored’ — emerged and went viral on social media and also broadcast by some television news channels recently.

The ‘new’ video, in a step-by-step manner, attempts to illustrate how the audio of an event preceding a student’s rally addressed by Kumar where pro-Afzal Guru slogans were actually raised on campus, was superimposed over the audio of a gathering where he raised slogans against Capitalism, the Caste System and Brahminism etc. This, then, was used as the basis for Kumar’s arrest by the Delhi Police on charges of sedition.

“The video has been despatched to a forensics laboratory located outside Delhi for examination and a report on the same is expected by the middle of the coming week,” said the official.

In addition to the report of forensic examination, the overall report — directed to conduct an inquiry as per orders issued by Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia late last Saturday — is expected to be submitted by Mr. Kumar to the Delhi Government ‘well before the 15-day deadline’ as initially required.

According to senior government officials, the decision to constitute a Magisterial probe in the case was taken in line with a request to this effect made by left leaders led by CPI (M) general-secretary Sitaram Yechury and consisting of CPI national-secretary D. Raja and K.C. Tyagi of the Janata Dal (United) during their meeting with Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal last Saturday.

The said contingent had called on Mr. Kejriwal after a meeting to discuss action taken by the Delhi Police against students union leaders with Union Home Minister Rajnath Singh and senior members of the MHA.

The ‘new’ video attempts to illustrate how the audio has been superimposed
title: Video sent for forensic tests
